title: The Day My Pet Learned to Text
story:
It all started on a {1} afternoon when my pet {2} stared deeply into my phone and suddenly typed "{3}" with its {4}. At first, I thought it was a glitch—or maybe I'd eaten too many {5}—but then it sent a selfie with a filter that made it look like a {6}.

By dinner, it had already posted three memes, joined a group chat called "{7}," and ordered a crate of {8} from an online store called "SnailPrime." I caught it trying to DM my {9}, asking for tips on how to do a proper {10}.

Then it started livestreaming. Viewers thought it was performance art. One even donated {11} to see it reenact a scene from "{12}." My phone was blowing up faster than a {13} in a tumble dryer.

Eventually, the news picked it up, and now my pet is sponsored by {14} and signs autographs using a {15}. Meanwhile, I still can’t get a text back from my dentist.

inputPrompts.prompt: Adjective, describing weather or mood (e.g., gloomy, sparkly)
Animal you’d want as a pet but probably shouldn’t
Weird phrase someone might text you at 3 a.m.

Brand name, real or fictional
Noun, an unusual writing tool

title: My Ridiculous Job Interview
story:
I arrived at the office wearing my lucky {1}, which I found under a {2} during a camping trip. The receptionist handed me a clipboard made of {3} and asked me to fill out a form using a {4}.

The interviewer walked in wearing a suit covered in tiny {5} and introduced themselves as Dr. {6}. We shook hands, but instead of a handshake, they insisted on a traditional {7} greeting from the planet "{8}."

They asked if I could operate a {9} while blindfolded and riding a {10}. I said yes, obviously. Then came the skills test: they handed me a rubber chicken and said, “Demonstrate how you would handle a {11} emergency.”

For the final question, they asked me to describe myself in exactly {12} syllables while balancing a {13} on my head. I gave it my best shot, ending with the phrase, "{14}."

I didn’t get the job, but they did offer me a free lifetime supply of {15}, so I consider that a win.

title: Time Travel Trouble
story:
I accidentally invented a time machine using a {1}, a roll of {2}, and pure spite. My first destination? The year {3}, right in the middle of a {4} convention held inside a giant {5}.

People wore clothes made entirely of {6} and greeted me by offering a {7}. I tried to blend in by pretending to be a professional {8}, but my {9} gave me away.

I ran into my future self, who had a robotic {10} and spoke only in Shakespearean insults like "{11}!" They warned me to avoid the {12} at all costs—or risk turning into a sentient {13}.

Before I could react, a time security guard riding a {14} shouted, “No unauthorized {15}!” and zapped me back to my timeline.

I woke up in my garage, clutching a half-eaten {1} and wondering if I should try again tomorrow.
